newsitem.title: INDIA: NBC launches NBC and CNBC channels in India.
newsitem.headline: NBC launches NBC and CNBC channels in India.

text.p: National Broadcasting Company (NBC) of the U.S., a General Electric Co unit, on Thursday announced the launch in India of two 24-hour channels, NBC and CNBC.
From Thursday, Indian viewers will be able to receive entertainment and information on the NBC channel and business and financial news on the CNBC channel.

"Digital television is the latest technological innovation, and with this launch, NBC Asia has put India at the forefront of that technology - leading the way in Asia," NBC Asia president S K Fung told a news conference in Bombay.
The company said it will be the first broadcaster to launch a digital service in India. CNBC was available in India since May 1996 through state-run Doordarshan's Metro channel.
NBC and CNBC will be shown on the AsiaSat 2 satellite as part of STAR TV's multi-channel pay package for India with STAR Movies.
Officials said Delhi-based Television Eighteen Entertainment Ltd will be NBC's Indian programming partner.
IGE India, also a General Electric Co unit, will provide programs for CNBC. IGE is also in the process of constructing a studio in Bombay that will produce local Indian programmes.
Fung said NBC had reached an agreement with IN Cable, part of the Hinduja group and hoped to reach its two million subscriber base.
IN Cable will be one of NBC's major customers in India and would distribute it to all the cable systems that they deal with.
Fung declined to talk about NBC's investment plans in both the channels but was confident that the channels would be a success.
The CNBC business channel will run a stock ticker on the bottom of the screen carrying the latest quotations from the Bombay Stock Exchange and from regional exchanges.
